thread.title: 4 children nominated for bravery award

author: tribuneindia.com
title: 4 children nominated for bravery award
text:
Tribune News Service
Dehradun, October 1
The Uttarakhand State Council for Child Welfare here today nominated four children for the National Bravery Award. Of the four nominated teenagers, two are from Pauri Garhwal district while one each is from Haridwar and Tehri districts. The first nomination Robin (17) is from Beenamalli village of Pauri Garhwal. Robin received grave injuries while rescuing his friend from a leopard in May 2015. Naveen (18) from Dikchali village from the same district rescued Mohit (13) when he was drowning in the Nayar river in August this year. Arjun (16) from Mathkudisain village in Tehri district, saved his mother from a leopard when it attacked her in 2014 while Abhishek Dhiman (15) from Haridwar district has been selected for his contribution to the welfare of poor children. Kamleshwar Prasad Bhatt, Joint Secretary, Uttarakhand State Council for Child Welfare, said the names of the four children had been sent to the Indian Council for Child Welfare (ICCW). He said the ICCW would take the final decision. It is worth mentioning that eight children from the state have been bestowed with the National Bravery Award.
